Judul: DETERMINATION OF DESIGN FOR TETRAMERIZATION OF DIMERIC MANGANESE SUPEROXIDE DISMUTASE FROM STAPHYLOCOCCUS EQUORUM USING IN-SILICO APPROACH
Abstrak:
The recombinant manganese superoxide dismutase from Staphylococcus equorum (rMnSODSeq)
has been modified to improve its stability for use as a therapeutic agent. The enzyme activity
depends on the stability of its dimeric form and higher oligomeric form appears to improve the
enzyme stability. This research was aimed to find the protein design for tetramerization of
rMnSODSeq. Naturally occurring tetrameric SODs from Mn/FeSOD family were used as candidates
for the structural references and were considered as eligible reference based on their structural
similarity with rMnSODSeq and thermostability. The result showed that tetrameric human
mitochondrial MnSOD (MnSODH) and bacterial MnSOD from Thermus thermophilus (MnSODThe)
are the best candidates. These two are distinctive due to differences in their monomer structure
conformation and therefore produce two distinctive tetrameric configurations. The design based
on the MnSODH configuration required modification involving the stretch Leu39-Gln68 in
rMnSODSeq to introduce a hairpin structure mimicking the structure of MnSODH that involves in
tetramerization. On the other hand, the design based on the MnSODThe configuration required
less modification that includes Asp61Ala, Asn134Ala, Asp135Leu, and Lys154Leu to prevent
clashes and create hydrophobic environment in the tetrameric interface.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Dr. apt. Aluicia Anita Artarini, S.Si., M.Sc.,
Dr. Ratna Annisa Utami, S.Si., M.Si.
Kata Kunci: superoxide dismutase, tetramer, protein design, protein modeling, Staphylococcus equorum
